newsitem.title: USA: Physician Corp expects to post Q4 charge. [CORRECTED 13:53 GMT 22/2]
newsitem.headline: Physician Corp expects to post Q4 charge. [CORRECTED 13:53 GMT 22/2]

text.p: Physician Corp of America said Thursday that it expects to take an additional fourth quarter charge of about $80 million (corrects from $60 million),
or $1.54 per share, in its workers' compensation subsidiary.
In November 1996, the company took a $130 million charge related to the same subsidiary.

The charge relates to increased liabilities associated with the workers' compensation division. Physician Corp discontinued writing all workers' compensation-related insurance coverage in November 1996.
The company said it has not yet determined the effect of the charge on its proposed March 31, 1997, merger with Sierra Health Services Inc.
